name: BetterSearch - remove inapproapriate elements
description:
BetterSearch is a fantastic Firefox addon, but it adds goodies to Google search results without regard for the filetype of that search result.

This style removes those elements that are inappropriate for that particular filetype (odt, pdf, etc).  For example, a "preview" of a .doc file will launch a download command (and NOT show a preview), but a preview of a pdf works just fine.

Enjoy!  ...and as always, please leave comments.

(06-23-07 - Updated to include topic specific Google searches: Linux, BSD, & microsoft)
(03-15-08 - Updated to include gz filetype [and also fixed a typo])
(10-15-08 - Updated to include additional elements)
(10-16-08 - Updated to include more additional elements - Google News, Google Shopping, etc)
(11-05-08 - Updated to include docx, xlsx, pptx, and ppsx filetypes)
css:
@-moz-document url-prefix("http://www.google.com/search?"),
               url-prefix(http://www.google.com/linux?),
               url-prefix(http://www.google.com/bsd?),
               url-prefix(http://www.google.com/microsoft?) {

/* :: RECOGNIZED filetypes :: */

/* Open this result in a new window */
.g > .w + .r > [href$=".pdf"] + span > a[title="Open this result in a new window"],
.g > .w + .r > [href$=".PDF"] + span > a[title="Open this result in a new window"],
.g > .w + .r > [href$=".ps"] + span > a[title="Open this result in a new window"],
